reviewText:
Well what can I say about another MOBA style game with a pay to play front? The same as any other game. Dont take it serious, this game is all about brute force and how fast to can Power Shot your opponent.

First things first: Play with friends. Trust me pre mades and Group fights are quickly a drawn back. Solo is not so great since the game rewards team work.

The crafting system reeks of pay to win aspect, with a hint at hey if you play long enough you might get that item you want." Which is ok for my self I dont mind. I dont like the fact that most items during the building/Crafting process take real time to make. Kind of lame and again very pay to win. you can spend money to speed up the process. crafting items are giving by winning and losing matchs. with varying amounts each time. Multiple play thrus will get you closer to that item you want.

Skill Tree: muiltple skills with varying abilitys. My healing spells were very good for a rank 2 chacter.

Points= EXP: Sadly no real large amounts of points where giving for healing. I healed about 17K one round and only got around 345 points. where as the lead team had about 1200 points. Game seems eager to give more points for Objective and Kills
date:
rather then Support. Sucks but what ev.

reviewText:
In my honest opinion, Panzar is not worth playing it. I will list a few positive points, and I will list the points why I do not recommend it.

Positive:
- It is Free-To-Play.
- The graphics are pretty good.

Negative:
- Microtransactions make part of being good.
- Some game mechanics are vague and not (properly) explained.
- Buying VIP makes you able to craft more, and such.
- It has one game mode, that isn't all that fun to play on.
- While advertising with huge customization, the customization rather lacks.

These negative points are very disturbing.

OVERALL RATING: 4.5 out of 10

Caution: The mentioned negative points may be changed due to recent patches.

Panzar is a truly unique game in its genre.

You get to choose to play from 8 different classes unique in their own way to fit your playstyle.

I would recommend panzar to any multiplayer action game fan!

reviewText:
ММО-боевик — жанр популярный, но несколько однообразный. Какую игру ни возьми, везде перестрелки, пулемёты, гранаты и прочие атрибуты современного треша.

Странно, что онлайн игра Panzar — явилась чуть ли не первой удачной попыткой сделать настоящий командный экшен в стиле фэнтези. Хотя идея очень долго витала в воздухе.

Панзар - игра бесплатная и от русских разработчиков, что радует, так как проект сделан на мировом уровне, благодаря передовому движку Cry Engin 3 Конечно, это не Crysis с точки зрения физики.

Зато всю мощь знаменитого немецкого движка вы можете оценить по графике игры, которая на голову превосходит всё, что я когда-либо видел в онлайне. С первых же минут вы сразу же убедитесь, что Панзар — это удивительно красивая ММО-игра.

Рисовка уровней поднята на беспрецедентную высоту. Все текстуры проработаны очень качественно. Подобную графику не часто встретишь даже в современных офлайн-играх, чего уж говорить об онлайне, где модельки из десяти полигонов и локации, от которых вытекают глаза, вполне привычное явление.

В Панзаре же мы видим совершенно иную картину - если это снег, то виден каждый сугроб, если это луга, то видно, как переливается на солнце буквально каждая травинка, если вода — то живая, журчащая, бегущая меж камней, скалы так и хочется пощупать, а уж какие здесь деревья! Прорисован каждый листочек, каждая иголочка на сосне. Причём пропорции персонажей и окружающего мира абсолютно реалистичны.

Но графика — это ещё не вся игра, скажете вы, и будете правы.

reviewText:
Just a few thoughts on the game after the inital 30 minutes.

- Just downloaded this game. It's riddled with display bugs - I set my resolution to 1920x1080 and I was unable to remove my cursor from the screen while in game. I set the resolution to 1600x900 - windowed mode, and the same issue persisted.

- The combat is very clunky, and blood flys from your SWORD rather than the ENEMY you attack, very weird.

- Some of the UI is cut off on the bottom, you can only see half of your icons on the hot bar which makes it frustrating to see which hotbar icons you are clicking or pressing via keyboard.

- The game itself is visually appealing, and very pretty. Models are great, and the character design is very intuitive. Character creation is similar to WoW/MMO-like.

Overall, very good visual state, just some lacking issues with the video displays, UI, and mouse overlay.

reviewText:
This is the ♥♥♥♥♥iest experience I've ever had with a game. Please, for the sake of your sanity, NEVER play this. At least, not past the tutorial.

The tutorial was actually ok. It was pretty simplistic, but the dialogue was funny, and the voice acting was... passable. Each class gets a unique tutorial, which I appreciated. The graphics, which I set to mid-level, were good for the most part, but everything that was far away would jump in and out of existance all the time, which was really annoying. All-in-all, not great, but not terrible, which is leagues above most F2P games.

Then came the letdown. I joined a PvE match, which went fairly well. It matched me with an array of teammates pretty quickly, and it loaded up speedily. As soon as it started, though, everything went downhill. Out of all of our team, we only had one damage-dealing class, which became a huge problem right out of the gates. The game throws undreds of enemies at you, which wouldn't be a problem if they were weak. Unfortunately, the weaker ones took 10 hits from our strongest fighter, and the elite mobs took closer to 50. You can't inturrupt them, either, but they sure can inturrupt you! Some of the later-level mooks can stun you for a good 5 seconds at a time, and have a short cooldown on the stun attack. Even better, they come in groups of 8-10, swarming you while your teammates are busy with the other 6 swarms of baddies. My favorite enemies, though, are the kamikaze goblins. They come up, throw a bomb at their feet, and wipe out the whole team. I played a tank, and at full health, I could only take 2 of these guys, and you can't defend from explosions. at one point, we had to get through a cave, which was filled to the brim with around 25 of these guys, and HUNDREDS of the stun guys. Needless to say, I was frustrated at that point. The best part, though, came soon after that. After getting pushed into the 1-hit-kill WATER about 5 times, by teammates, enemies, and glitches, I alt-tabbed out to check skype, upon which the game dissapeared from my desktop. It was still on, it showed up in task manager, it just did not show up on the bar at the bottom of my screen. I could not play the game after alt-tabbing. No. Thank. You.

This game is terrible. This game makes me want to stab my computer with a knife. Please don't give these people money.

reviewText: The game is decent, but because there are potions, you can face opponents that just spam potions. Matchmaking is horrible, you can be level 1 facing level 10, with no way to do anything to them. The crafting is real time based, and you can spend real money to skip the timer. All the items that impact gameplay can be crafted, as well as purchased with real money. The opponents can block frontal attacks, but turning is faster than running behind, so they in 1v1 they can pretty much block you and wait for help to arrive. The game focused more on zerging than individual play. It's free so feel free to try it yourself. I quit after 3 games.
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
After booting the game up I met my first problem: the game wasn't scaling correctly for my ordinary monitor (BenQ G2450HM) so I had these black bars that covered my bottom abilities bar. So I changed to resolution to 1920x1080 and that didn't help at all. The game still has these weird black bars on every side and it looks cramped. Sure, I could see my abilities bar again but why can't the game be put on full screen? Why does it have to make it smaller and screw up my firefox on my second monitor? (BenQ GW2450HM) Christ almighty what a bad start.

Ignoring those issues I thought that perhaps the game would be better. OH BOY WAS I MISTAKEN.

The first 10 seconds into my game, it just stopped completely. It just shut down and Steam syncronized as it does when you close a game. Fine. I boot it up again. This time I got to do my character but then it crashed immediately. Great. So I go into the forums and apparently, I'm not the only one who gets constant crashing. So I do what they say: validate files on Steam. Sure enough the game has to download 54 missing files! Uuuh? What? Then my launcher tells me I have to download an additional 100mb of update.

The game has been out since the 12th of April 2013. Perhaps time to step up your game development team?

So after all that baloney I finally make my Dwarf Cannoner. I enter the the tutorial AAAND it crashes. WHOPPIE. What a fantastically optimized game. I launch it again and this time, I am able to play through the tutorial and get to the end. By the way, perhaps you should nerf the guards who defend the gate? Since they one hit the zombies and you can barely get a swing at the zombies before they die, I don't see why there is such a rush to help them defend. They could exterminate the entire tutorial island without an issue and still be back for tea time.

After that god awful tutorial I click the big red button that says PLAY!

My first map is the one with the lava that comes up from time to time. I rush out with my team and set up a machinegun so I can blast away the enemies. Except the gun does pretty much zero damage and I overheat my gun and get killed. My camera goes absolutely bananas when the lava starts coming up and then the game crashes!

Majestical performance.

I boot up the game and immediately press play and jump into a game. Before I go any further, is there some secret that I don't understand about respawning? I got into a fight and killed some mentalist guy and he respawned before I could set up my turret as a Dwarf cannoner. As I was building it, the same guy bootlord" or something
date: came running up to me and bashed my head in. While my respawn timer was nearly 19 seconds long. He on the other hand had plenty of time running around
recommended: slaughtering my team. I saw no way of respawning faster or anything! I played the entire round but we got steam rolled since "Bootlord" or whatever his name was constantly ran out from spawn after he died and pretty much handed our poor
hoursPlayed:
uncoordinated butts to us.

Con's:

-Can't handle 1920x1080 for some reason

reviewText: This game pits you in PvP combat with mediocre gameplay. The weak gameplay wouldn't be too bad on its own since the teamwork part of gameplay isn't all that bad. Where the game really fails is its leveling and gear mechanic. You start at level 1 and are pit against players of all different levels. You have to level to gain power in a vertical climb which is made even worse by the gear which enhances everything about your character. To make matters worse, gear is crafted using random drops from PvP matches (the game ONLY has PvP). It'smuch simpler to buy the game's cash shop currency and get an entire set of gear for your level, however, leaving new players at the mercy of those who are willing to shell out cash. It's very unlikely you'll manage to get the materials you need to get gear at your level to survive in combat, so you'll spend hours getting one shot and bashed in the face by players who are higher level and have better gear. The game is a practice in masochism in both its leveling, gear crafting, and weak gameplay. I do not recommend that anyone play this unless they're willing to shell out cash to stay on an even battlefield with other players.\n\nThis review was made at the behest of a player who countered my argument of, If a player doesn't enjoy the game from the beginning
date: why would they suffer it until it stopped being terrible?" with

reviewText: Such a bad game, mega times on loading, had to tweek many things just to get it runing. Getting into a game with several classes is practicly impossible - 30 minute waiting for a game is not that everyone can handle. 2 minutes just to check for updates, so when i tried to just get it running, it took 2 hours from my life, and half of that was just because of the scanning that must be done EVERY SINGLE TIME, nevermind that you just checked 5 secs ago. OK, got it running (atlast), created a character, tried to play a tutorial, crashes again (after 30 minutes of searching for cure, found out that the game doesnt support certain properties of nvidia, fixed it no prob), i get into a game again, and to get you guys understand what i'm talking about is 5 minutes loading screen on my powerful PC. SO after 2 hours i run the game, create a character with a class i dont admire, quite an unpopular one, and i start searching for a MATCH. And i'm stuck on loading time once more, now 15 minutes of loading have passed already and there is no response what so ever in that regard. This is a disgrace, really, most of these F2P games are soooo damn uncoded, they have an excelent idea, but the programming background is so shady... I'm not the one to cry about F2P games, i just tried most of the games that are out there and i'm searching a game, which i would enjoy, and yet i could spend money on (i'm a game geek). Conclusion - another unsuccesful steam powered game, had HIGH expectations for this one, and yet again (like with Path of Exile) it let me down just because of the coding side of he game.

reviewText: Looking into this game shows that it has a ton of potential. I may not have played it for long, but I couldn't. I've spent easily 4 times longer on load screens than I have anything else. I managed the tutorial quests on two of the characters and have crashed three times. My computer is more than powerful enough for this to run at maximum settings with no issues, yet I get low framerates and of the jumpiest, messiest gameplay I've ever experienced in a game. This is coming from the tutorial so i can only imagine what actual gameplay looks like. As of now, the game is mostly unplayable. If they fix the lag, load time, and crash issues, the game could be more than well worth the effort. Until then, I'd reccomend reading other reviews and possibly avoiding it all together.

reviewText:
I gave it the length of a regular feature film, about 90 minutes, before I decided it was a terrible waste of time.

Starting with the Pay to Win features... from level 1-4 took those 90 minutes. You are able to craft gear, or buy it with real money. The crafting requires loot given at the end of matches, as well as a time restriction. By the time I had reached level 4 I was only able to craft 2/6 level 1 pieces of gear. Level 4 is the next tier for equipment, and I had reached it before having even HALF of the level 1 equipment crafted. Whereas if I spent real money, everything would just be mine... and I could go on to melt faces with my wallet protected character.

Now the classes... I enjoy healing so I normally play support. In Panzar the healer is the Paladin... very low damage and very low survivability (As he can't heal himself unless healing others, and the self-heal is maybe 10% of what others are healed for). So basically any opponent who is paying attention can kill you fairly quickly. Gameplay is basically horribly imbalanced.

Now for the player base. Many players just seem to ignore objectives and run into the closest fight. Players with experience never share it, they simply call everyone noobs when the team starts to lose. No advice or direction, no leadership... just insults.  It's basically like any online PvP oriented game.

I would give this game a 3/10. Good ideas but a horrible execution.

And my absolute least favourite thing is jumping. The jumping animation for character is terrible. Worst jumping I have ever seen.

reviewText:
Mixed feelings about this one. I liked the class selection and found that each class was reasonably balanced, but the game does a lot of F2P elements that I dislike. Crafting is done via real time, so it can take hours (maybe days) to craft new equipment for your character. There are a number of other things that give off the feeling of pay2win. To be fair, I didn't spend a whole lot of time with the game, so I could be mistaken on that.

The gameplay is basically King of the Hill with some variation depending on the map you are on. Hit detection is pretty weak (making it hard to determine if you're actually hitting your targets) and the animations are poor. The player-to-player collision is frequently obnoxious, because it allows you to push your allies around (or be pushed) and allies are often in the way.

The game also follows the unfortunate trope of half-naked female characters.

Overall, I had some fun playing it, but I can't really see myself going back for more.

reviewText:
EDIT: Since the infamous update which ruined the game COMPLETELY this review is no longer valid. This game is 100% Pay2Win.

The launcher is buggy, requires to fiddle around and google for solutions for update. Game itself is fun, fast paced team arena style game.
Controls feel responsive, although if not for the hit marker you wouldn't be even able to tell whether you hit somebody or not, becouse it feels like you are swinging in the air. Gameplay is fun, although most of the time it's steamrolling becouse everyone either uses tanks to spam and blitz win, or they spam with turrets which is no fun for the most part. The game itself however does offer many customization options in the means of armor, character looks and powers. It has a forging system which is tedious becouse it requires you to farm materials, and that takes time. And of course you can pay real money and level and equip your character fully as it is in the most games, which makes the game kinda P2 win. But for a F2P game it has a lot of potential and is at times extremely fun to play.

reviewText: Beautiful game, but the combat is horribly dry. It utilizes simple attacks and 'power' attacks, alongside several class-specific abilities that grow in number and power as your character progresses in levels. Unfortunately, the attack have very little 'weight' behind them, and typically one on one combat is devolved to strafing while tossing out little and big hits and the occasional burp of an ability. The fact there are currently no North American servers in operation is also a deterrant to American, Canadian and so on players that seek a PvP experience with a PING level promoting completely even playing grounds. Also refer to that fact that equipment can be outright bought with real life money, thus possibly leading you to combat peers with armor leagues ahead of what you could have possibly acquired without paying. This game is a neat concept with outstanding visuals, but the gameplay falls just short of being worth an extended commitment of time for your typical PvP-game hungry gamer.

reviewText:
Absolute pay to win garbage.  In most MOBAs you get a hero with abilities that you level up throughout a match. In this one you level up by playing matches and gain permanent abilities on your account.  It's a grind fest which starts off insanely inequal with matches being decided almost entirely by who has more newer players on it.

Feels a lot like Warhammer Online: Wrath of Heroes... and that's not a good thing.  Hit detection is just really off.

Do not waste your time with this guy.  It won't take you too long to realize it just wasn't worth installing.

reviewText:
The concept isn't bad, but the game needs a lot of work.

The characters seem to move in slow motion, so there is really no way to attack someone without getting hit in return, which means whoever has more hitpoints when the fight starts pretty much wins by default. The animations are a joke, your character can't really jump without looking like he's trying to fake a moon landing, but for some reason he sniffs his pits every 5 seconds, then wretches at the stench. I guess pit sniffing took priority over smooth combat animations.

The class balance is completely worthless, the tank class is essentially immune to ranged attacks, so since every single match is won by controlling a wide open control point whichever team has more tanks has an absurdly huge advantage. You simply can't win if your team consists of a majority of ranged characters, the win condition is controlling a point, and the enemy unit that does it can't be hurt from a distance. Healers can't heal themselves, so they are completely worthless unless your team has 2 of them that can heal each other, as the enemy will single out and kill a lone healer in seconds every time. Frost mages can freeze you solid, then kill you before you have any real chance to react. The slow animations really rear their ugly head when an enemy is using a highly telegraphed PbAoE spell that you absolutely need to avoid and you're simply unable to waddle out of its range or interrupt it before it hits you.

One look at the team compositions will tell you who wins the match every single time. Since the reward for winning is twice what you get for losing it's extremely frustrating to rarely ever have a close match.

This game is also the worst kind of Free to Play there is. From the moment you start the game it's clear that it is built to frustrate you unless you pay. Everything worthwhile is purchased with their premium resource. Whether or not you can get items without paying for premium is pure luck, as you have to construct them from resources that randomly drop from matches. The only upside is that the premium services are cheap, but the game itself simply isn't good enough to bother with.

reviewText:
The game should really have been a Diablo 2 style co-op adventure with a similar FTP model to path of exile, that would have been considerably better than this.
It's a great looking game, The design behind the characters is slightly odd, but beautifully rendered none the less. However the PVP combat is the focus and its unfortunately terrible.

Feel free to download if you really enjoy tight messy battles where all you do is left or right click.
Just bear in mind this is just another fancy looking money sponge.
2/10

reviewText:
A very beautiful game. Loads of potential. An friendly community that helps out alot.

But the pay to win aspect is just horrible. After 3 games I hadnt got enough materials to make 1 potion but I slightly use between 5-10 potions per game. Buying 1 potion costs 1 diamond (roughly 150 gold) and I made 12 gold in total for those 3 games.

So in 60 games I can buy 1 potion, unless I dont get the right material to craft one. Do the math.
Buy an Playstation 4 instead, it's pretty much worth it.

reviewText:
A lot of potential - but for now... Sloppy

Initial Thoughts:

This game look great, interface is clean and easy to navigate. Queues are way to long with no real indication that the game is doing anything. I thought my system was slow loading at first but then I realized it was just the game rounding up players. PvP gameplay leaves a lot to be desired. Enemy tags sometimes show up late and since you are playing folks from all around the world there is latency issues. It is kind of chaotic at times. Doesnt feel as if you are doing any damage because there is no significant reaction to a successful hit, a small combat text is shown but it feels soft. A bunch of orcs swinging away on a capture point feels sloppy. If the devs went and played SMITE - copied their queue system and took notice to their combat - this game would be gold. Otherwise, I feel it will just fade away into nothingness.

reviewText: Calls itself an MMO when it is not; it is arena style combat.  Sluggish combat, mages have little to no mana, no reconnect on connection lost, mm system leaves much to be desired.\n\nInteresting idea, needs more polish but the graphics aren't half bad.

reviewText: dis gaem iz prety fun i like palayin it evry now and then again. it ha sum uniqe class and ech one play a little different bit. if u lik fast pace pvp actin game i wood recommend dis 4 u. a lot of people dont lik e tha cash shop but its still a game based on skill above items. if u have time to sink and want to get into a game similar to wrath of heros but wit h more of a rpg side such as gear and craft i wood highly a lot reccomend it\nalso u obtain in game currency dat can be used to get premium tim e evory time u level so after 3 levels u could go premium fo a day. i can see it is sort of a little bit of a grind.\nif u ar e unsure of playing trying this game i would just try it for a bit. has potential to a lot of fun but cash shop and crafting mite turn away people.

reviewText: Can't even say I got a good chance to play this game enough. First game I glitched out, and second game froze up and game crashed. Ok so 3rd time, 3rd party (where no healers actually help you, lucky you get potions) I win and get some exp, oh wait 50% reduction in exp because I quit 2 times" but really it wasn't my fault.\n\nGraphics are good
date: game mechanics seems interesting. I like the idea of team based games but... the match making is random (like COD BO2 team death match). Havent seen a healer actually heal
recommended: instead run into mobs and die. That and constant confusion and dazed skills the monsters have. It makes the game very frustrating and very time consuming.\n\nI'd consider playing more if there was North american server with people who read and write english. If I give this game another chance ( 5 games all frustrating and annoying)

reviewText: It just feels weird, silly animations along with some very strange character design. And no people are not wrong when they say that it, like many games these days, although being free-to-play is pay-to-win. You can craft items, and wait real time for them to finish crafting OR you can instantly buy them with crystal-looking things that you can, of course, purchase with real money. I'm not really sure what this game is trying to be, but as an amalgum of it's part as a whole, it is just a weird experience and not one i'll be going back to.

reviewText:
Matchmaking is so crappy...
Installed game and now I am uninstalling it...
Read my story.
I have downloaded and launched the game, created a character and then i got a popup that i can have some currency for clearing tutorial - why not?.
Tutorial cleared (I fought, shot some fireballs and entered the black hole.), now tutorials at menu - It asked me to put one skill point to one skill - why not again? That was a good skill so i put that point.
And finally game tells me that I am ready to fight and there's a big arrow directed at the big play button.
Ok so I am thinking about looking at wardrobe, weapons or something usefull before battle and then...
...NOPE - you must battle and pvp only! You can only exit game or fight - no other options. Meh ok so i clicked it and waited.
First I was thinking like - oh it is loading so long because of my crappy pc?
I went to look at the Internet and Steam discussion board  and i found that after last ♥♥♥♥♥♥ update game lost some playerbase and it was not my pc and long loading times...   ...It hasn't even loaded a map - it was searching for match.


Conclusion
Crafting chance system = less players, more waiting in queue and less money for devs - (good for them)
I am not telling that the game is bad or something (I didn't even had a chance to play one match)

But I'll rate anyways.
Frustration 420/10 IGN - I'am going to get addicted to smoking again

Such queue, so much wait. Would look at the upper right corner spinning blue thingies again.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Gave the game 2nd try affter a year. Game mechanics are basic and easy to understand. Ques are a bit too long, but I read somewhere that it's because there are few low level people to que with.
To be honest, there are too few classes and there is one class (the name I don't know) is so overpowered that literaly in 5 maps i took us 3 people to kill 1 guy with aroudn half HP.
Inventory is confusing too.

Overall I would recommend it when they make some changes, but untill then it's thumb down.

reviewText:
After 5 hours of playing it I am unsure how I feel about Panzar. I tried PVE from start as I thought it would ease me into the game but I found it so damn difficult, that was PVE on easy mode, die respawn die reaspawn like a really bad raid in WOW. PVP was too chaotic. Did I mention that 80% of players are Russian so you won't be able to communicate with them. No idea why they did not make European severs for the West.

Also the queue takes forever, can't go in it for PVP and PVE one or the other and whilst waiting you cannot use the foge, check character items skills etc to pass the time, you have to wait and look at the screen.

I will give it a few more goes and if no satidaction it will get uninstalled.

reviewText: This game looks like it was made with the Warhammer Online engine, stripped of any aesthetic value - which is impressive because WAR looked like hot ♥♥♥♥ anyway! It controls terribly, and for added benefits it straight up didn't recognize when I pressed the 1 key, which means I didn't get through the tutorial. What's great though - and I really, truly, definitely mean great - are the animations for female characters. They are COMEDY GOLD. Those butts swing as though they're trying to singlecheekedly cross the Atlantic, with every possible animation meant to draw attention to those prominent posteriors. They're so bad that if they were in an intelligently made game they could actually be believed to be parody. In this game, it is clear that they are a desperate attempt to keep a player invested in dressing up his elf in cash shop lingerie. Unfortunately in this age of easily-accessed porn, such simple dressup games no longer exhilarate me, and I cannot recommend Panzar: Elf Lingerie Broken Combat Simulator.

The game has all the makings of a top contender how ever it has one fatal flaw.
The game is majorly underpopulated and there is no ability to play PVE on your own.

Do not waste your time downloading atm as the current server system is poorly maintained and the matchmaking system in place does not work for such a game when it has only a hand full of active players. The best thing this game could do is bring in a proper PC server list rather than a poorly created matchmaking console system

reviewText:
Other than the bit below, it was great fun.

Shortly after I started playing, I had to perform a -=System Restore=- b/c the game crashed my desktop and video card.

Let's be clear here... It did NOT crash-to-the-desktop; rather it crashed the part of the Windows OS that controls the desktop then ***corrupted my nVidia drivers*** (320.49) so totally that Windows7 (64bit) couldn't detect my 2nd HDMI monitor.

I proceded to....
- Do a full shutdown and restart,
- Update to the latest  drivers,
- Complete uninstallation & clean reinstall of the old" 320.49 and then the newest drivers
date:
- Uninstall of the game and system shudown.

reviewText: At first, the gameplay is pretty fun with a nice difficulty and the graphics are nice, but it became obvious really fast that it's just a bunch of pay to win garbage. A person who doesn't want to spend a ton on micro-transactions is put at a severe disadvantage. You can pay to do literally everything - not just cosmetic stuff, but items that boost your performance, and even just straight up paying for levels. On any given screen outside the arena, there are a dozen prompts to spend money via micro-transactions.

reviewText:
Played it for like 50 mins the graphics are really nice & the idea like crafting gear in a arena fighter and spell tree.
Thats really about it i found the game hugely boring slow paced no skills really you have 1 attack so most of the time you are holding lmb and pressing block when ever needed and ocasionally pressing the rmb when you get a power up. The maps i played in the time where simply awful also, no hiding spots or anything really two spawns each corners of the map and very little inbetween.

The tutorial was laughable basically nothing happened it wasn't very informative of anything like the crafting system. At the start you are not able to craft anything like a starter set of armour so you are basically running around in nothing at all especially if you are the spell slingers what by the way if you are trying to make them look attractive change the face because they just look strange. Another thing in the main menu there was like 5 advertisements to buy their currency and you could actually level up ingame using this currency what's simply stupid in a game. The game also what i've heard and what i can now tell as you can also buy ingame gear what's also very silly as the main purpose of the game is to get gear? Also i found that 90% of the games i joined 12 year old kids where spamming their microphones giving me a headache mite of just been the 3 games that i played.

Avoid this game maybe try it just for a laugh. I don't even know why this has been brought to steam.
Also one bug that was REALLY annoying what i encountered was there was my mouse constantly on my screen but i sorted it by pressing T then esc.

reviewText:
I gave this game a try due to some positive reviews of other players, however I was disappointed. I tried the beserker class (damage dealer, melee)

The graphic is okay, but not awesome.
The controls are sluggish. It takes some practice to anticipate the enemies hit boxes correctly and fight effectively.

You have two main currencies: rubies in exchange for real money, and gold which is earned with each match you play.
I say main currencies" because there is something else which the game calls "ingredients" or "crafting material" which is also earned with each match you play. If you are on "VIP"-mode (costs real life money) you get more. These materials are used for crafting new equipment. Since the material you get is generated randomly after each match this is rather useless. They could have left out this kind of "currency" and replace it simply with the gold as well. It's just something which I would call a "fake-feature".

Crafting new equipment takes a lot of material. You get the possibility to craft new equipment by increasing your char level (done by experience gain through playing). While "light" and "medium" equipment seems achieveable in a reasonable amount of time
date: the best quality level "unique" takes material for which you can farm easily 50-100 matches (each match takes between 5 and 20 minutes). Then you have hopefully gathered enough material for one (1) crafting attempt. Yes
hoursPlayed: an "attempt"! For the "fun" of it you only have a -chance- of succeeding the crafting attempt. 70% for "light" gear
voteText: 50% for "medium" gear and 20% for "unique" gear
helpfulPercent: which only translates into even longer material gathering. If course you can increase the crafting chance
votesHelpful:
if you are willing to invest some rubies (money).

Now comes the real absurd part: You can as well buy any equipment for a relatively small amount of rubies (real life money) instant.
That is my major problem: Your choice is to spend hours over hours farming for materials for an item or you give in to the temptation and just buy the wanted item. The problem is the comparativeness. The pricing always suggest to just buy what you want
votesTotal:
but why playing this game at all if I just by anything I could achieve? For me the game makes itself obsolete in this way.

Add other factors like character designs which you can buy only for rubies (money) and which add "+xx.x% experience".
Add other equipment which you can only buy for rubies (not craftable) and in addition have their lifetime limited to 3
commentsCount: which means if you want a top equipped character
column16: you *will* have to invest in the game regularly.\nAdd consumables like heal potions which are also available for rubies (money) and if you don't have them
column17:
you can imagine the disadvantage on the battlefield.

So at the bottom note let me say: This game leaves you no chance to make up a missing investment by very good or very extensive playing. Forget it! Since this is a PvP game (with some PvE side-content) you need to be top equipped to have a fair chance against others and this requires you to invest money - regularly!

If you want to play to achieve access to better equipment and enjoy character progression
column18: you will be frustrated and I suggest you stay away.\nIf you just play for fun (PvP) without extras and you have no problem investing money regularly in order to keep your character in top shape
column19: you can give this game a try."

reviewText: After being forced to play tutorial which should have been optional this game forced me into spending attribute point on first skill then forces you to join a pvp match. Problem is once joining the pvp load screen it just sits there waiting. I couldn't find a single match so I don't reccomend it baed on the fact only the tutorial seems to work. Either that or everyone who plays is passed the first lv bracket therefore matchmaking can't find you a match. I never even got a chance to play. BROKEN ♥♥♥♥ING DESIGN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: This game looks great, but it plays like garbage. The controls are oversimplified, with nothing beyond a few class-based abilities as well as the standard hit/heavy/block. Despite this being a game about combat, there is no kill counter, or clear way of knowing how effective you are actually being. To add to this game's problems, the crafting system is needlessly draconian, and, though I only played a dozen matches or so, it SEEMS that there is heavy P2W at work. Its free, so I wont tell you not to buy it, but if you've got limited bandwidth, you're better off just watching Netflix.

reviewText: I really enjoyed playing this game in its beginning launch and the next 200+ hours of gameplay over the year. The graphics and battle dynamics are outstanding, and initially it had a good crafting system. The resources you earned verses the cost of crafting higher end armor and weapons was scaled against you steeply but was acceptable. Sometime between 8/10/2014 and 8/11/2014 an update removed the ability to craft entirely, replaced with shop function only. Resources earned now, go towards a roulette game that doesn't nearly adheer to the probability statistics advertised. What was a great game for computer players has been reduced to a cell phone game in leage with Kim Kardashian : Hollywood"
date: you meerly pour money in for gear necessary for playing at high level. If they reverse the update launched on above dates I will probably continue playing

reviewText:
Pros -
- Lighthearted, humorous design.
- Playful artwork.

Cons -
- PvP is nothing impressive.
- PvE elements are basic.

Overall: There is no harm in trying this game since it is free to play and while I enjoyed the artwork, this game had little more to offer me. It is complete enough for mild entertainment but I would only recommend if you seek a mild PvP experience in the fantasy genre.

reviewText: The positive outlook of the game is the concept is very good, maps are neat, graphics are very cool.  However, due to the fact the game is over seas, there is a red alert problem with lag for all of america.  The grouping system mixing lowbies with fully geared and max lvl players is rediculously terrible idea.  The Mastery system is overpowered to the people who buy more of it, but i guess thats the name of the game right?  The blocking mechanics is wrong, blocking should be 90% damage reduction across the board for ALL players at ALL times and should ignore any amount of mastery an enemy has.  Cheers :)

reviewText:
Graphics - 6.5/10 - Average - Some reason the goofyness feel and the cluster ♥♥♥♥ of idiocracy overdid it for me... I know plenty who like it however, it just didn't pull it off in my taste ;'/.

Gameplay - 6.75/10* - Spectacular~! Note*: The game's build system is extremely crucial, unfortunately it feels like some skills can truly screw you up if you build improperly which makes me feel as if I'm too powerful, and other's are ♥♥♥♥. I presume that ruins gameplay for others which I took into rating.

Community - 5.5/10 - The community is pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, but if I was comparing to other MOBA's it'd be average 6.5/8.

Customization - 4/10 - Growth is extremely unique to each and every character due to the large skills to pick from and limited points. I disliked one big thing was the equipment, there's only one way- Gearing upwards. Now the game is pretty screwed due to the fact people can now buy levels makes it feel.. Cheap.

Replayability 6.5/10 - The game's different classes vary so much that everytime it's something different, each person brings a different build to the table. However, it is still a forward MOBA; Fight over and over except you can carry on some RPG-Elements such as leveling. Fun to try and gain, but I left primarily cause there's just better MOBAs out there, and the new Buy levels" Option sort've killed it for me.

Overall - Below Average (*5.15*); If the game didn't have the option to buy levels
date: and since they went with RPG-Elements why not more cosmetic options? It's a core thing
hoursPlayed: and one of the most rewarding thing is seeing the armor you got on you- And changing
voteText: evolving
helpfulPercent: and feeling more and more powerful.\n\nUnfortunately this game took on RPG-Elements
votesHelpful: but didn't give something incentive to play for it - So people buy it
votesTotal: \nOver and out

reviewText:
This game is so beyond buggy.
The developers honestly did not give a ♥♥♥♥ about proper coding or anything in this game.
I wonder why they would even bother to try to appear as if they are seriously even able to compete in the same name-brand market as Valve, Blizzard, etc.
This game could have been interesting, if one could get past the constant bugged loading screens and insanely long que-times.
In the two hours I tried to play this trainwreck of a game, I did the following;
I. Watch Naruto: Shippuden Movie 1.
II. Shave my legs.
III. Contemplate the estoteric meaning of life and figured out the answer to lifes greatest question.
What is the meaning of Life?
The answer is:
Not playing this rachet AF game, gurl.
